material.mattext: What is the main purpose of ADO.NET architecture in .NET Framework?
To provide a platform for web application development.
To handle network communication between client and server.
To provide a set of libraries and tools for accessing and manipulating data in databases.
To create user interfaces for Windows Forms applications.
[____] component of ADO.NET is responsible for establishing a connection to a database?
What is the role of a Data Provider in ADO.NET architecture?
It provides a way to define and execute SQL queries.
It establishes a connection to a database.
It manages the flow of data between the application and the database.
It handles the authentication and authorization process.
Which component of ADO.NET is responsible for retrieving and updating data in a database?
Data Provider
Connection Pooling
Data Adapter
Command Object
What is the role of a Data Adapter in ADO.NET architecture?
It provides a way to define and execute SQL queries.
It establishes a connection to a database.
It manages the flow of data between the application and the database.
It handles the authentication and authorization process.
What is the purpose of Command Objects in ADO.NET?
To optimize database performance by reusing database connections.
To handle data synchronization between multiple threads.
To store and manage data retrieved from the database.
To execute SQL queries and interact with the database.
[____] component of ADO.NET is responsible for storing and managing data retrieved from a database
[____] is a set of libraries and tools for accessing and manipulating data in databases.
Which namespace in .NET provides classes for database programming with ADO.NET?
System.Data
System.IO
System.Collections
System.Text
The [____] class in ADO.NET represent a connection to a database.
How can you establish a connection to a database using SqlConnection in ADO.NET?
By using the `new` keyword followed by the SqlConnection class name.
By handling the SqlConnection's Connect event.
By using the MessageBox.Show method.
By providing a connection string to the SqlConnection constructor.
What is the purpose of the SqlCommand class in ADO.NET?
To define a connection string for connecting to a database.
To execute SQL queries and retrieve data from a database.
To represent a connection to a database.
To read and write data from a database.
The [____] commandType enumeration in ADO.NET specifies an SQL statement to be executed at the data source.
The [____] commandType enumeration in ADO.NET specifies the name of the stored procedure to be executed at the data source.
During the execution of commands using Command objects, the [____] method is used when the desired return value is DataReader object.
During the execution of commands using Command objects, the [____] method is used when the desired return value is single value.
During the execution of commands using Command objects, the [____] method is used when no row is expected to be returned.
During the execution of commands using Command objects, the [____] method is used when the desired return value is an XMLReader object.
How can you execute a SQL query using SqlCommand in ADO.NET?
By handling the SqlCommand's ExecuteQuery event.
By subscribing to the SqlCommand's MouseEnter event.
By using the MessageBox.Show method.
By using the ExecuteNonQuery or ExecuteReader method of SqlCommand.
What is the purpose of the SqlDataReader class in ADO.NET?
To define a connection string for connecting to a database.
To execute SQL queries and retrieve data from a database.
To represent a connection to a database.
To read and write data from a database.
How can you read data retrieved from a database using SqlDataReader in ADO.NET?
By handling the SqlDataReader's Read event.
By subscribing to the SqlDataReader's MouseEnter event.
By using the MessageBox.Show method.
By calling the Read method of SqlDataReader in a loop.
The [____] event occurs when the mouse pointer moves while it is over a control.
The [____] event occurs when the mouse button is released, typically before the MouseUp event.
The [____] event occurs when the mouse pointer stops and rests over the control.
What is the purpose of the MouseClick event in C#?
It is triggered when the user moves the mouse pointer over a control.
It is triggered when the user clicks the mouse button on a control.
It is triggered when the user releases the mouse button after clicking.
It is triggered when the user presses a key on the keyboard.
How can you subscribe to the MouseClick event of a control in C#?
By handling the control's Click event.
By subscribing to the control's MouseDown event.
By using the MessageBox.Show method.
By providing a custom event handler for the MouseClick event.
Which event is triggered when the user presses a key on the keyboard?
KeyPress
KeyDown
KeyUp
KeyChar
What is the purpose of the KeyDown event in C#?
It is triggered when the user presses a key on the keyboard.
It is triggered when the user moves the mouse pointer over a control.
It is triggered when the user clicks the mouse button on a control.
It is triggered when the control is loaded and displayed on the form.
How can you subscribe to the KeyDown event of a control in C#?
By handling the control's Click event.
By subscribing to the control's MouseEnter event.
By using the MessageBox.Show method.
By providing a custom event handler for the KeyDown event.
What is a property changed event in C#?
An event triggered when a control's property value is modified.
An event triggered when a control is added to a form.
An event triggered when the user clicks a button on a form.
An event triggered when an exception occurs in the code.
How can you subscribe to a property changed event in C#?
By handling the control's Click event.
By subscribing to the control's MouseEnter event.
By providing a custom event handler for the property changed event.
By using the MessageBox.Show method.
What is a delegate in C#?
A keyword used to define a class.
A type-safe function pointer that references a method.
A control used to handle user interactions in Windows Forms.
A built-in class used for file input and output operations.
What is the purpose of delegates in C#?
To encapsulate a method and allow it to be passed as a parameter.
To define the layout and positioning of controls in Windows Forms.
To store and manage data in memory.
To provide a way to interact with databases.
What is an EventHandler delegate in C#?
A delegate used to handle events in Windows Forms.
A delegate used to perform arithmetic calculations.
A delegate used to define properties and methods in a class.
A delegate used to interact with the file system.
How can you declare and use a delegate in C#?
By using the `new` keyword followed by the delegate name.
By subscribing to the delegate's Click event.
By using the Delegate.Create method.
By providing a custom event handler with the appropriate event arguments.
What is the purpose of the EventHandler delegate in C#?
To handle events and pass event arguments.
To define the behavior and operations of a event.
To control access to properties and methods in a event.
To handle event calculations.
How can you subscribe to an event using the EventHandler delegate in C#?
By handling the event in the form's constructor.
By setting the control's Event property to the desired event.
By using the `new` keyword followed by the event name.
By modifying the control's Text property.
What is the signature of the EventHandler delegate in C#?
void EventHandler(objects sender, EventArgs e)
void EventHandler(object sender, EventArg e)
void EventHandler(object? sender, EventArgs e)
void EventHandler(object sender)
How can you raise an event using the EventHandler delegate in C#?
By handling the event in the form's constructor.
By subscribing to the delegate's MouseEnter event.
By using the EventHandler.Show method.
By invoking the delegate with the event arguments.
The event model in the .NET Framework is based on having an event ________ that connects an event with its ____________.
model, handler
handler, delegate
delegate, handler
delegate, model
[____] event is triggered when a user changes the selection in a ListBox control
What is the purpose of the KeyPress event in C#?
It is triggered when the user clicks the mouse button on a control.
It is triggered when the mouse pointer enters the boundaries of a control.
It is triggered when the user presses a key on the keyboard.
It is triggered when the control is loaded and displayed on the form.
The [____] event is triggered when a form is loaded and displayed on the screen
[____] extension represents the Windows Forms designer file in Visual Studio.
How can you persist data in a Windows Forms application?
Use a database
Use text files
Use application settings
All of the above
[____] control is commonly used to display images in a Windows Forms application?
How can you handle user input in a Windows Forms application?
Use mouse events
Use keyboard events
Use control events
All of the above
How can you navigate between different forms in a Windows Forms application?
By using the Tab key
By setting the Visible property of forms
By handling the MouseEnter event
By using the MenuStrip control
How can you handle exceptions in a Windows Forms application?
By using try-catch blocks
By ignoring them
By using the MessageBox.Show method
By handling the Click event of a Button control
How can you dynamically change the text of a Label control in a Windows Forms application?
By modifying the Label's Text property
By handling the Label's Click event
By using the Console.WriteLine method
By setting the Label's Enabled property to true
What is the purpose of the ErrorProvider control in a Windows Forms application?
To display error messages in a message box
To validate user input and display error icons next to controls
To play audio and video files
To navigate through directories
[____] event is triggered when the value of a CheckBox control is changed
How can you display a tooltip with additional information when hovering over a control?
By handling the MouseEnter event
By setting the Enabled property of the control to true
By using the Console.WriteLine method
By using the ToolTip control
How can you change the font style of a Label control programmatically in a Windows Forms application?
By modifying the Label's Font property
By handling the Label's Click event
By using the MessageBox.Show method
By setting the Label's Visible property to true
How can you hide a control in a Windows Forms application?
By setting the Enabled property of the control to false
By handling the MouseEnter event
By using the Console.WriteLine method
By setting the Visible property of the control to false
How can you handle keyboard input in a Windows Forms application?
By handling the KeyPress event of a control
By ignoring it
By using the MessageBox.Show method
By using the Timer control
Which section of the Toolbox in Visual Studio contains commonly used controls like Button, TextBox, and Label?
Common Controls
Containers
Common Controls Box
Regular Controls
[____] categories feature of the Toolbox in Visual Studio allows you to group controls for better organization.
[____] section of the Toolbox in Visual Studio contains controls for data access and data binding.
How can you add a new form to a Windows Forms application in Visual Studio?
Right-click on the project in Solution Explorer, select "Add New Form."
Click on the "New Form" button in the Visual Studio toolbar.
Type "AddForm()" in the code editor.
Go to the View menu and select "Add New Form."
How can you set a fixed size for a form in Visual Studio?
Set the form's MaximumSize and MinimumSize properties to the same values.
Lock the form's Size property in the Properties window.
Use the SetFixedSize method in the form's code-behind file.
Type "Fixed = true" in the form's constructor.
What is the purpose of the Anchor property for controls on a form?
It determines whether a control can be resized.
It specifies the control's initial position on the form.
It determines how a control is automatically resized as its parent control is resized.
It determines whether a control can be moved.
What is the purpose of partial classes in C#?
To improve performance in large applications.
To allow a class to be split into multiple source files.
To enable multiple inheritance in C#.
To define abstract classes.
How are partial classes defined in C#?
By using the `partial` keyword before the `class` keyword.
By using the `partial` keyword after the `class` keyword.
By using the `partial` keyword before each method declaration.
By using the `partial` keyword before each property declaration.
Can a partial class be split across different namespaces in C#?
Yes, it can be split across different namespaces but same assembly and same module.
No, all parts of a partial class must be in the same namespace and same assembly and same module.
Partial classes cannot have namespaces.
No, all parts of a partial class must be in the same namespace but different assembly and same module.
How are same defined methods from different parts of a partial class resolved at runtime?
They are automatically merged into a single method.
The compiler generates an error due to method conflicts.
The methods are resolved based on the order of declaration in the source files.
The methods are resolved based on the access modifiers applied to each method.
Are partial methods required to have an implementation in all parts of a partial class?
Yes, all parts must provide an implementation for a partial method.
No, parts can choose to implement or leave out the implementation of a partial method.
Partial methods are not allowed in C#.
Partial methods are automatically implemented by the compiler.
How are partial methods declared in C#?
By using the `partial` keyword before the `method` keyword.
By using the `partial` keyword before the return type of the method.
By using the `partial` keyword before the method name.
By using the `partial` keyword before the access modifier of the method.
What is the purpose of the TrackBar control in Windows Forms?
To display a progress indication for long-running operations.
To allow users to select a value from a range using a sliding thumb.
To display and edit dates and times.
To navigate through directories.
What is the purpose of the Dock property in Windows Forms controls?
It enables automatic resizing of the control based on the form's size.
It enables automatic resizing of the control based on the resizing of its parent.
It controls the visibility of the control on the form.
It determines the font style and color of the control's text.
Which values can be assigned to the Dock property of a control in Windows Forms?
Top, Bottom, Left, Right
Vertical, Horizontal, Center
Expand, Fill, Auto
Start, Middle, End
How does the Dock property affect the positioning of controls in a container?
It allows controls to be docked to any side of the container.
It evenly spaces controls within the container.
It stacks controls on top of each other within the container.
It aligns controls to a specific area within the container.
What is the purpose of the Anchor property in Windows Forms controls?
It determines the font style and color of the control's text.
It enables automatic resizing of the control based on the form's size.
It controls the visibility of the control on the form.
It specifies which edges of the control are anchored to the parent container.
Which values can be assigned to the Anchor property of a control in Windows Forms?
Top, Bottom, Left, Right
Vertical, Horizontal, Center
Expand, Fill, Auto
Start, Middle, End
Can a control have both Dock and Anchor properties set in Windows Forms?
Yes, both properties can be used together to achieve specific layout requirements.
No, using both properties simultaneously will cause conflicts and errors.
Only certain controls support both properties.
The Dock and Anchor properties are mutually exclusive.
Which property takes precedence if there is a conflict between Dock and Anchor properties?
Dock property takes precedence over Anchor property.
Anchor property takes precedence over Dock property.
Both properties are given equal priority and result in undefined behavior.
Only one can be set at a time, and the last one set takes precedence.
What is the purpose of layout managers in Windows Forms?
To control the visual appearance of controls on a form.
To manage the placement and resizing of controls within a container.
To handle user interactions with controls.
To define the behavior and events of controls.
Which layout manager in Windows Forms allows controls to automatically adjust their positions based on available space?
FlowLayoutPanel
TableLayoutPanel
SplitContainer
Panel
Which layout manager in Windows Forms provides a grid-like structure for controls with fixed rows and columns?
FlowLayoutPanel
TableLayoutPanel
SplitContainer
Panel
What is the purpose of the FlowLayoutPanel in Windows Forms?
To automatically arrange controls in a flow from left to right or top to bottom.
To display a group of controls within a scrollable area.
To divide the form into multiple resizable panels.
To organize controls in a tabular format.
How can you specify the position and size of controls in a Panel container in Windows Forms?
By setting the Dock property of each control.
By using the Anchor property of each control.
By specifying the location and size properties of each control.
By handling the MouseClick event of the Panel.
How can you nest layout managers in Windows Forms?
By placing one layout manager inside another as a child control.
By setting the Parent property of a layout manager to another layout manager.
Nesting layout managers is not supported in Windows Forms.
By handling the Layout event of a layout manager.
What is the purpose of the Label class in Windows Forms?
To display images and icons.
To play audio and video files.
To provide a clickable area for user interaction.
To display static text on a form or control.
How can you set the text content of a Label control programmatically?
By using the Label's SetText() method.
By using the Label's Text property.
By using the Label's Text() method.
By using the MessageBox.Show method.
How can you change the font style of a Label control programmatically?
By modifying the Label's Font property.
By modifying the Label's FontStyle property.
By using the Label's FontStyle() method.
By using the Label's SetFontStyle() method.
[____] event is triggered when the user clicks on a Label control.
[____] property determines whether a Label control can be resized by the user.
How can you add an image or icon to a Label control in Windows Forms?
By setting the Label's Image property.
By setting the Label's ImageIcon property.
By using the Label's SetImage() method.
By setting the Label's SetImageIcon() method.
What is the purpose of the Button class in Windows Forms?
To display images and icons.
To play audio and video files.
To provide a clickable area for user interaction.
To display static text on a form or control.
How can you handle a button click in Windows Forms?
By handling the Button's click event.
By handling the Button's onClick event.
By handling the Button's OnClick event.
By handling the Button's Click event.
[____] property allows you to specify the text content of a Button control
How can you disable a Button control in Windows Forms?
By setting the Button's Enabled property to false.
By setting the Button's IsEnabled property to false.
By setting the Button's Enable property to false.
By passing false to the Button's Enable() method.
[____] event is triggered when the user hovers the mouse over a Button control
[____] property determines whether a Button control can be resized by the user
How can you add an image or icon to a Button control in Windows Forms?
By setting the Button's Image property.
By setting the Button's ImageIcon property.
By using the Button's SetImage() method.
By setting the Button's SetImageIcon() method.
[____] property allows you to specify the color of the text in a Button control?
What is the purpose of the CheckBox control in Windows Forms?
To allow users to select at most one of the provided options.
To allow users to select zero or more provided options.
To provide options for users to deselect multiple options.
To display static text on a form or control.
How can you trigger a CheckBox's CheckedChanged event in Windows Forms?
By handling the CheckBox's Click event.
By subscribing to the CheckBox's MouseEnter event.
By selcting and unselecting the CheckBox.
By modifying the CheckBox's Checked property.
Which property allows you to specify the text content of a CheckBox control?
TextValue
SetText
Font
Text
How can you programmatically set the state of a CheckBox control in Windows Forms?
By modifying the CheckBox's IsChecked property
By modifying the CheckBox's checked property.
By modifying the CheckBox's Checked property.
By modifying the CheckBox's isChecked property.
What is the purpose of the RadioButton control in Windows Forms?
To display images and icons.
To play audio and video files.
To provide a group of options for users to select at least one.
To provide a group of options for users to select at most one.
What event is fired when RadioButton is selected or unselected Windows Forms?
OnClick event.
CheckedChanged event.
OnCheckedChanged event
OnSelectedChanged event
Which property determines the position of the check box inside the RadioButton control?
CheckPosition
CheckAlign
CheckAlignment
CheckPlacement
How can you group RadioButton controls together in Windows Forms?
By setting the same Name property for the RadioButton controls.
By placing them in the same Form.
By placing them in the same container.
By setting the same Id property.
What is the purpose of the ComboBox control in Windows Forms?
To enter data which is used to populate a selectable list.
To provide a textbox to type a list item and display a drop-down list of selectable items.
To provide a drop-down list of selectable items.
To display static text on a form or control.
How can you handle a ComboBox's event that occurs when a selected item changes in Windows Forms?
By handling the SelectedIndexChanged event.
By handling the SelectedItemChanged event.
By using the MessageBox.Show method.
By modifying the ComboBox's SelectedIndex property.
Which property allows you to specify the list items in a ComboBox control?
Items
Options
ListItems
Choices
What is a class in object-oriented programming?
A container for storing multiple variables of different types.
A collection of functions that perform specific tasks.
A blueprint or template for creating objects that have similar properties and behavior.
A structure that defines the layout of controls on a form.
How can you create an instance of a class in C#?
By using the `new` keyword followed by the class name.
By calling a static method within the class.
By subscribing to an event within the class.
By modifying the class's properties.
The purpose of a [____] in a class to provide a way to instantiate the class and initialize its state.
What is the purpose of a Panel control in Windows Forms?
To display images and icons.
To play audio and video files.
To act as a container for other controls and provide layout management.
To display static text on a form or control.
[____] property of a Panel control allows you to specify the background color
How can you add controls dynamically to a Panel in Windows Forms?
By setting the Panel's AutoSize property to true.
By handling the Panel's Click event.
By using the Panels Add() method.
By using the Panel's Controls.Add() method.

Complete the code snippet to add a Click event handler to the 'btnSubmit' button
 
btnSubmit.Click += new [____](btnSubmit_Click);

Given the code snippet below, answer the questions that follow:
 
class Program {
    static int number;
    static bool isFlag;
    static void Main() {
        Console.WriteLine(number);
        Console.WriteLine(isFlag ? "Flag is true" : "Flag is false");
    }
}

 

What will be the output of the following C# code snippet?
0 and "Flag is true"
0 and "Flag is false"
"number is null" and "Flag is null or empty"
"number is null" and "Flag is false"

Given the code snippet below, answer the questions that follow:
 
class Program {
    static int number;
    static bool isFlag;
    static void Main() {
        Console.WriteLine(number);
        Console.WriteLine(isFlag ? "Flag is true" : "Flag is false");
    }
}

 

What is the default value of the 'number' variable in the 'Program' class?
null
"number is null"
"number is null or empty"

Given the code snippet below, answer the questions that follow:
 
class Program {
    static int number;
    static bool isFlag;
    static void Main() {
        Console.WriteLine(number);
        Console.WriteLine(isFlag ? "Flag is true" : "Flag is false");
    }
}

 

What is the default value of the 'isFlag' variable in the 'Program' class?
null
"isFlag is null"
false
"isFlag is false or empty"

Given the code snippet below, answer the questions that follow:
 
class Program {
    static int number;
    static bool isFlag;
    static void Main() {
        Console.WriteLine(number);
        Console.WriteLine(isFlag ? "Flag is true" : "Flag is false");
    }
}

 

What does the following line of code do in the 'Main' method of the 'Program' class?
 
Console.WriteLine(isFlag ? "Flag is true" : "Flag is false");
It prints "Flag is true" if the 'isFlag' variable is false, otherwise it prints "Flag is false".
It prints "Flag is true" if the 'isFlag' variable is null, otherwise it prints "Flag is false".
It prints "isFlag is null" if the 'isFlag' variable is true, otherwise it prints "isFlag is false".
It prints "Flag is true" if the 'isFlag' variable is true, otherwise it prints "Flag is false".

What is the value of result after executing the following C# code snippet?

int[] numbers = { 10, 20, 30, 40, 50 };

int result = 0; f

oreach (int num in numbers) {

result += num;

}

What is the value of num after executing the following C# code snippet?

int num = 10;

num *= 2;

num -= 5;
How can you convert a string to an integer in C#?
int.Parse("42");
Convert.ToInt32("42");
(int)"42";
int.Parse(42);

What does the following C# Windows Forms code snippet do?

Button myButton = new Button();

myButton.Text = "Click Me";

myButton.Location = new Point(100, 50);

myForm.Controls.Add(myButton);
It creates a new Button control and sets its text to "Click Me". Then it sets the button's location on the form to (100, 50) and adds the button to the form's Controls collection.
It creates a new TextBox control and sets its text to "Click Me". Then it sets the textbox's location on the form to (100, 50) and adds the textbox to the form's Controls collection.
It creates a new Label control and sets its text to "Click Me". Then it sets the label's location on the form to (100, 50) and adds the label to the form's Controls collection.
It creates a new ComboBox control and sets its text to "Click Me". Then it sets the combobox's location on the form to (100, 50) and adds the combobox to the form's Controls collection.

What does the following C# Windows Forms code snippet do?

PictureBox pictureBox = new PictureBox();

pictureBox.Image = Image.FromFile("image.png");

pictureBox.SizeMode = PictureBoxSizeMode.StretchImage;

this.Controls.Add(pictureBox);
It creates a new PictureBox control, loads an image from a file named "image.png," and displays it in the PictureBox with a stretched mode on the form.
It creates a new PictureBox control and sets its image property to null.
It creates a new PictureBox control, loads an image from a file named "image.png," and displays it in the PictureBox with the original size on the form.
It creates a new PictureBox control, sets its image property to null, and then adds it to the form's Controls collection.

Complete the code snipnet

ComboBox cmbColors = new ComboBox();

cmbColors.Items.Add("Red");

cmbColors.Items.Add("Green");

cmbColors.Items.Add("Blue");

cmbColors.SelectedIndexChanged += new [____](cmbColors_SelectedIndexChanged); Form.Controls.Add(cmbColors);

Complete the code snippet

Button btnSubmit = new Button();

btnSubmit.Text = "Submit";

btnSubmit.[____] += new EventHandler(btnSubmit_Click);
A [____] enables you to create different views of the data stored in a DataTable
Derived classes can also [____] inherited members by providing an alternate implementation
In order to be able to override a member, the member in the base class must be marked with the [____] keyword
In C# the [____] modifier is required to extend or modify the abstract or virtual implementation of an inherited method, property, indexer, or event.
In C# the [____] keyword enables you to create classes and class members that are incomplete and must be implemented in a derived class
In C# the [____] modifier is used to declare that a structure type is immutable
In C# the primary constructor parameters to a record are referred to as [____] parameters
When applied to a class, the [____] modifier prevents other classes from inheriting from it in C#.

Complete the code below:

public [____] Person(string FirstName, string LastName);
